Australians‚Äîthis might help you:
I was recently very ill late at night. A nurse suggested I phone 13CURE, an after hours medical service that bulk bills. A caring GP video called at 2am and was able to help, sending a script to my local pharmacy. There was no out of pocket cost.

Tears tonight. Remembering holding the hands of precious elders, keeping them company in their dying time. Thank you for expressing care, anger & rage at #letitrip. We are being robbed of treasures of immeasurable value. The grief shows that we care and we are paying attention.

To care for our elders is to care for our ancestors‚Äô babies when the ancestors have crossed over. Honouring elders by caring for them adds joy, meaning, connection & richness to life. These busy politicians have probably run too hard all their lives to know. And it shows.

When a politician tells us that their policy decisions are breaking elders, I want them to break down. I want sobbing. I want sensitivity. Regret. I think I watch the media conferences looking for signs of humanity. But they talk like they broke something that was already broken.

Our elders are sacred. All of them. Some of them teach us about the beauty of gentleness, tenderness & touch when language & memory has faded. Others because they hold wisdom that comes from years of paying attention. They‚Äôre our ancestors: the people that held us as babies.

When I hear that most of the Covid deaths overnight were elders, it‚Äôs like hearing that a library of precious books has caught fire & all the stories are gone. The painful, preventable deaths brought about by Australia‚Äôs #letitrip policy failure are tragedies, every one of them.
